_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Main equipment and safeties during 5 year MI audit

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source
Lineage has a long-standing commitment to the workers, the public, and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the ammonia refrigeration system's design, operation, and maintenance. Lineage's policy is to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  
Program 3 at Lineage LogisticsVernon 5/6 is a facility-run program that operates under the continuous support and guidance of the Lineage Safety and Compliance Department, including Process Safety Management (PSM) Compliance and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Compliance, ensuring comprehensive safety measures are in place.   

2.	Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled
LineageVernon 5/6 is located at 2045 East Vernon Avenue, Vernon, California. The area immediately surrounding the facility is mostly commercial and industrial.
The regulated substance handled at our facility is anhydrous ammonia. 
The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.  All of the ammonia inventory is used as refrigerant.

3.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
As part of implementing the RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage Vernon 5/6, which also serve to manage process safety issues associated with anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  The regulated substance is over 10,000 lbsthe federal EPA RMP and OSHA PSM threshold.   As a result, the anhydrous ammonia-covered process (ammonia refrigeration system) is subject to OSHA PSM and EPA Program 3.
Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:
	Process Safety Information

	Process Hazard Analysis
	Operating Procedures
	Training
	Mechanical Integrity
	Management of Change
	Pre- Start Safety Review
	Compliance Audits
	Incident Investigation
	Employee Participation
	Hot Work Permit
	Contractors

4.	Five-Year Accident History
For any accidental release meeting the five-year accident history reporting criteria of §68.42(a), the owner or operator shall submit as part of the RMP the information required by Section §68.42(b) on each accident covered by section §68.42(a).
"The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage."
LineageVernon 5/6 has had no releases in the last five years that meet the five-year accident history reporting criteria; therefore, no data is required. 

5.	Emergency Response Program
LineageVernon 5/6 has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, provide first aid and medical treatment, and contact federal, state, and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia. The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, such as the local fire department or HAZMAT Team. 

6.	Planned Changes To Improve Safety
Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:
	A compliance audit was performed on October 24, 2023.
	A Process Hazard Analysis, which was performed on April 16, 2024
	A Hazard Assessment, which was performed on May 2, 2024
	A 5 Year Mechanical Integrity Audit, which was performed on April 23, 2024
Any outstanding recommendations from these studies, including the target completion date and/or closure, have been provided within each individual report and tracked by the facility recommendati
